snippet: After months of Republican obstructionism, the community service program finally has a new leader. Now it needs the financing and support to do its vital work.
abstract: Editorial cites Senate confirmation of Wendy Spencer to lead Corporation for National and Community Service, which oversees AmeriCorps, after months of Republican obstructionism; warns budget for AmeriCorp is shrinking; holds Spencer's challenge will be to work with Pres Obama and Senate supporters to keep program at its current level.
lead_paragraph: After months of Republican obstructionism, the community service program finally has a new leader. Now it needs the financing and support to do its vital work.

headline.seo: Congress Needs to Step Up for AmeriCorps
headline.main: Congress Needs to Step Up for AmeriCorps
headline.print_headline: Congress Needs to Step Up for AmeriCorps
